customer_reviews.title: Think you need a new computer because yours is slow?
customer_reviews.text: It used to be that adding RAM was the easiest and cheapest way to speed up a slow computer. That never addressed the real bottleneck of a computer, which is the hard drive. I had a customer complaining that they probably needed a new computer even though theirs was only a little over a year old. Knowing that they had a standard platter-style hard drive, I suggested this. Boy is she glad that I did! Saved her hundreds of dollars on a new computer and likely thousands on lost time waiting for her computer to 'compute' as her entire business relies on her computer to make her money.
customer_reviews.author: Helpful_Amazon_User

customer_reviews.title: Fake!!!!! BE WARNED!!!!! EVEN AMAZON CHOICE IS NOT TRUSTWORTHY
customer_reviews.text: What is a king share SSD???? I do not know what this is. Started building my computer today and noticed this wasn’t Samsung. The package was sealed as well!!! And I almost put my OS on it. Clearly can’t be trusted!! I rather get Western Digital. Motioning to complaint on my order
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: I've had 5 Samsung 850s and love them, never had a problem until this 860
customer_reviews.text: I've had 5 Samsung 850s and love them, never had a problem, and I know this experience is pretty rare. This drive though didn't even make it 6 days before the read/write failures filled up the win event log. The constant need to retry reads/writes made it impossible to even get the data off the disk once failure was observed. I'm not saying you should avoid this product; I believe in Samsung SSD drives. This particular drive failed though. Take that for what it's worth.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too many software issues, was not able to clone
customer_reviews.text: As the title said, I never even was able to clone my source drive to this. I’m sad to write this review because my drive right now is the 850, which worked no problem when I got it a couple years ago. From what I read, I experienced a common problem among other users during the clone process where the error message about defragmentation kept coming up. I came across several different DIY fixes and workarounds that still even did not allow for successful cloning. Trying all the different things still to no avail is not worth my time. Returning and already a Crucial replacement, hopefully their software isn’t as buggy.
customer_reviews.author: Brady

customer_reviews.title: Bad out of the box
customer_reviews.text: These things happen, and I'm a big fan and user of Samsung products, and this experience has done nothing much to change that. I didn't attempt to use it until after the return window closed, so I had to go to Samsung for warrantee help, and after they evaluated my situation, they authorized a return for repair/replacement at no charge. This is still in process, so, assuming Samsung does as I expect, I'm sure I'll ultimately be a satisfied customer. More to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Ken M

customer_reviews.title: Incompatible with AMD am3+ Sata controlers
customer_reviews.text: Great price per gb, but the controller in the drive is not compatible with AMD Sata Controllers. This will result in long system hangs, minutes long, triggered by small qued writes. Continually throws crc errors. Do a little goggle before purchase if you have an am3 system. Crucial drives do not have the same issue. Drive returned... Refund issued.
customer_reviews.author: Cms10

customer_reviews.title: Corrupts easily
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I bought this to speed up the new computer we purchased for my father for Father’s Day. We set it up and had it working just fine, gave it to my dad, he plugged it in, and it was corrupted and had wiped itself clean of everything that we had just spent hours trying to get setup. My husband has done this before so he knew what he was doing. It was very disheartening to spend so much money on something and have it completely break down before you can even use it. And of course, we found out it didn’t work after the return window shut down so that was added disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: It ran for a couple days then....blue screen of death and I lost all data.
customer_reviews.text: It installed easily and ran for a couple days then....blue screen of death and I lost all data. Could not even boot to safe mode. Since it is very unlikely that the hardware failed (no moving parts - solid state) it probably has a bug in the program that is on the controller inside the device that trashed the file allocation table making all data unreadable. Replace with Western Digital Flash drive and it has worked well for a few months now. Don't stop backing up your data just because you bought a SSD. I know they should not fail quickly ...but my Samsung did.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Ring

customer_reviews.title: update 11/11/2018
customer_reviews.text: Speed is defective. I have the older SSD and faster I will tell you after experience both my kingston A400 faster in game & editing I swear I'm not kidding I spoke support Samsung and they said : you have a normal non-defective. it seems relatively slow Many advertisements for this product
customer_reviews.author: Q8 Tech

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for PS4 Pro performance upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: I love that this SSD works perfectly with a PS4 Pro. It cuts loading times and significantly improves frame rate. For example, a game like Monstet Hunter World without an SSD would take almost a full minute to load a stage, with the SSD the loading is practically nonexistent. Literally takes 10 seconds or less. Definitely worth getting if you’re looking to upgrade your gaming PC or your PS4 Pro. I don’t recommend it for standard PS4 though, the change in performance is not that significant. Hope this review helps a fellow PS4 console enthusiast.
customer_reviews.author: Celeste Gonzalez Ramos

customer_reviews.title: 2 Samsung SSD DOA in a row!!!
customer_reviews.text: This makes 2 in a row dead on arrival!! extremely disappointed in Samsung about this..3 different computers could not read, identify, or recognized either of the 2 drives (tried multiple cables, multiple ports, formats etc). ....I purchased a western digital sdd and it was perfect...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: samsung magician says - everything is fine! Any other utilities just fails to re-read informations ...
customer_reviews.text: I've spent 3 days trying to install fresh OS on this drive. 3 days f different issues, unstable work. samsung magician says - everything is fine! Any other utilities just fails to re-read informations from on test runs.
customer_reviews.author: Observer

customer_reviews.title: Samsung Magician Claims SSD "non-genuine"
customer_reviews.text: Initialized and formatted the SSD for NTFS out of the box. Samsung Magician says the SSD is non-genuine and is not supported. Cannot even install the latest Samsung Magician software because Samsung limits the daily downloads.
customer_reviews.author: Hod

customer_reviews.title: Downgrading to Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: Microsoft keeps nagging me that they plan to abandon the slender, high-performance Windows 7 operating system, so I am reluctantly building another computer to accept the downgrade to their surveillance-loaded, overweight W10 with mandatory advertising and degraded UI. That said, the Samsung solid state drive has made for a rapid bootup, very fast store and recall, and swift internet exchanges. It was installed without any complications in an i7 Optiplex (Dell), and accepted a fresh install of the bloated W10 "Home" edition. Did I imply how much I dislike Windows 10? The SSD is highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: P. Carson

customer_reviews.title: 3-5 minute lockups  read forum posts on 860 first
customer_reviews.text: The drive is fast. quick boot up but randomly 1-20 times a day my pc would lock up for 3-5 minutes with 100% ssd drive utilization with 0 processes taking up any I/O write reads. all over the forums about people with issues with this. I purchased WD Blue 1TB instead have had 0 issues in the week i have been using it. with the samsung 860 i fresh installed 3 times went through forums did everything they suggested. Samsung software said firmware was out of date but said my drive didnt need to update it. so saved 40$ and got a drive that works and is close to as fast.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Came with scratch, I thought I bought a new product?
customer_reviews.author: Emmanuel

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with AMD’s SATA controller but still works
customer_reviews.text: It’s not compatible with AMD’s SATA controller. The 860 freezes the whole operating system while it’s in use. Samsung does not have a firmware update to fix this problem. I suggest getting WD, Crucial or Sandisk SSD if you are using AMD. To get the drive working, I had to replace the AMD's SATA Controller driver with Microsoft's Generic AHCI Controller driver. But by doing this, the controller floods my Windows event log with device errors. The CRC error count go up in S.M.A.R.T. each time a disk error is logged. I can use the drive normally without any problems, but in the long run I’m not sure what will happen if the CRC count keeps increasing.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Go to website for installation and data migration.
customer_reviews.text: The installation worked very well. The instructions that come with the drive are almost useless. Fortunately I went to the Samsung website and found a data migration software just for Samsung SSD’s. The transfer and migration worked perfectly. A small flyer included with the drive called “Miacle Drive”, can be downloaded from Samsung, which has a lot of great tools to manage your drive. It is “a must have” application!
customer_reviews.author: Ray J. Gans

customer_reviews.title: This drive was not an original Samsung drive
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to use this drive as a replacement for an older Samsung SSD drive. After cloning and installation the first thing that I noticed was my BIOS did not see it; I still managed to get my system to boot and after running the Samsung Magician software it gave me a message that the drive was not genuine. I removed it and installed my original drive. My original drive has the Samsung Logo in the upper right hand corner, this one doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: VERY POOR INSTRUCTIONS AND SUPPORT
customer_reviews.text: Where are the detailed instructions???!!! The manual Samsung sent just has six very small diagrams!!! Do I need a special cable to fist plug the SSD into my USB or can I install the SSD in my desktop and then just copy over my hard drive??? When you go do download the Magician software you get a notice from Samsung that states, "Unfortunately, the download limit for the day has been reached, please try again within 24 hours." THIS TOTALLY SUCKS!!!
customer_reviews.author: austin_reader

customer_reviews.title: BEST SATA SSD on the MARKET, with RAPID MODE looking to be faster even than NVME Drives, Not Sure How ...
customer_reviews.text: The Sunsung magician software shows that the drive runs much faster when you enable Rapid Mode. Apparently there is cache on it. I am using a Dell Optiplex 9010 SFF, i7-3770 16gb Ram with it, and did a fresh install of windows 7 on it with all the updates . Attached are screenshots, from original and then with rapid store and crystal mark and the magician software. Perhaps further testing is in order, but so far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent space for today's demanding games at a palatable price
customer_reviews.text: Decent amount of space (4TB), and the price dropped quite enough to be barely palatable (~ 1,000 USD at the time of writing this). I hope more affordable larger capacity SSDs become the norm very soon, as steam / origin / ubisoft games are becoming more and more demanding in storage and SSDs affordability / capacities don't seem to be catching up quick enough. Samsung of course I believe is one of the leaders in SSD storage. I lost count of how many Samsung SSD drives I've purchased over the years, and thankfully they all still serving me without fail till today in various system builds I have. So I highly recommend their SSDs.
customer_reviews.author: Oxygen

customer_reviews.title: WARNING  Unable to register the product on the Samsung Website.  Are these really SAMSUNG?
customer_reviews.text: WARNING Unable to register the product on the Samsung Website, for the warranty Are these really SAMSUNG? We purchased Two 2TB EVO 860's and One 550Gb EVO 860. None of these will register for warranty. BAD SAMSUNG...
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend (2 of 2)
customer_reviews.text: This is a cut and paste of the first review. Exact same issue. I tend to favor Samsung SSD. When the last drive was out of space. I purchased this drive. During the install process of Windows 10 Pro, I started getting drive errors on reboots. Windows would complete updates and reboot some disk errors and sometimes none. After one reboot and more disk drive errors. Finally after a reboot it reboots directly to disk errors. I purchased a different manufactures SSD.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: I am sure the hard drive is great, but I can't talk about that yet
customer_reviews.text: I am sure the hard drive is great, but I can't talk about that yet. Amazon sent me a used hard drive with someone else's OS install already on it, and documents containing personal information (Name, address, telephone number, SSN, etc). Who knows what else? Potentially malware as well, so that's fun. I grabbed a screen shot of Samsung Magician as well showing that 2.6TB of IOPS have already been recorded on the drive as well. I'll update with a proper review when I receive a drive that hasn't already been used by someone else and returned.
customer_reviews.author: A. Shurts

customer_reviews.title: Faster than advertised
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the 2TB model for $295 Pros: Excellent Packaging. After formatting to NTFS the Samsung software benchmarked this at ~1200-1500MBps Read/Write. Advertised is ~540MBps Same 'available space' after formatting as a 2TB FireCuda, about 1.82TB (Flash memory keeps an unpartitioned space to prevent over-writing and data loss) Cons: Could not clone via USB interface with Samsung software. Cloning and Installation: If using a SCSI over USB enclosure you need to install generic usb device drivers over the SCSI controller drivers. Ended up using free online cloning software after doing this, as it would still not recognize. If you have an additional HDD bay this shouldn't be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Product arrived without drive in box - shipping materials undamaged -- Obviously stolen at shipper
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing wrong with this product, in fact I've purchased four of them recently for work. What's wrong is that Amazon order fulfillment seems to be deteriorating rapidly - missed shipment dates several times and now arrivals with obviously stolen expensive goods. Stolen drive is S/N S59VNJON618589 - if you see it on eBay, etc. please report it. Well, to be honest, there's no way to report something stolen by Amazon, or stolen goods by eBay. Great product but we customers are doomed.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Bergsten

customer_reviews.title: Not supported SSD with AM3+ system
customer_reviews.text: After cloning my system to new SSD Samsung Magician can't recognize new drive. Re-installed system from zero. Samsung seen SSD but benchmark R/W test took almost 30 mins and result was lower than expected. My system based on AMD AM3+. When cloned system on my laptop Dell under Intel I haven't had any issues except low R/W speed results (224/262). Old SSD Evo 850 works perfectly fine, but new one has compatibility issues. Returned...
customer_reviews.author: Viktor

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for Xbox One X/PS4 Pro consoles
customer_reviews.text: I have been keeping an eye on the Evo 2TB SSDs for my PS4 Pro and Xbox One X for some time, but the price was too high for my tastes. Thanks to the Black Friday sale and the price finally went down under $300, I bought it and immediately saw a difference in all of my Xbox games compared to the Seagate SSHD drive, or standard HDDs. My only issue is Amazon only allowed 1 per customer. SSDs are finally down to mass pricing and I recommend this to all gamers, as it is cooler, quieter, faster than standard drives and games load much faster.
customer_reviews.author: H. MCGEE

customer_reviews.title: Very fast, stable, and endurance for a SATA drive
customer_reviews.text: This drive is a great cost-effective SATA SSD drive for use in upgrading an older computer. If your motherboard doesn't have compatibility to use an m.2 NVMe drive, this one is a great cost to performance drive. It's not the fastest drive, but it's fast enough to make your old hard drive look like a dinosaur. Easy to install and upgrade, as long as you know how to transfer data, or do a fresh Windows install. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas & Jessii

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer support
customer_reviews.text: Nice SSD drive, good "theoretical warranty", however, when the drive died after 1 year and I spent all the time on the Samsung site registering and going through all the subscreens, I am told that this does not qualify for mail-in support. After 1/2 hour on the phone, the closest support center is an hour drive away. Pretty worthless warranty
customer_reviews.author: JGMD

customer_reviews.title: I almost gave this 4 Stars . . . .
customer_reviews.text: When you use it as an external USB storage drive, Samsung's Magician software does not support it. I've read that it may be supported if installed internally with a SATA connector. Won't initialize otherwise. Had to research and go through a special procedure to get it to work as an external USB drive. But it is now working fine and am using it as a backup storage drive with Windows 10 Pro, Version 1903. I gave it 5 Stars because they are reliable and Samsung SSD's are top-of-the-line.
customer_reviews.author: R. E.

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe the speed increase.
customer_reviews.text: It's like having a new computer. it does not come with hardware to mount it in a 3.5" bay, so if you don't have a spare 2.5" bay in your machine you will need a 3.5 to 2.5 adapter. My Dell OptiPlex is so old it did not have a usb 3.0, so I bought the following with my SSD. the install was fairly simple after that.  and a  download a good cloning program, clone your exsisting hard drive onto the SSD then swap out the old hard drive for the new SSD and WOW!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Sims

customer_reviews.title: FREE cloning software doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: The 'FREE' magician software doesn't work. This is the software needed to clone your existing drive to this new drive. I should have read the comments on the Samsung site about this software not recognizing the new drive. There is no remedy. I had to buy $39 software to use this drive. I should have purchased the Crucial drive, since it's 'FREE' software seems to work with the Crucial drive and there weren't bad reviews. 'THIS DRIVE NOT RECOGNIZED'...UGH!
customer_reviews.author: BobInIndy

customer_reviews.title: Recieved an unmarked incorrect ssd
customer_reviews.text: Instead of getting a 860 evo 2TB, I actually got a unmarked 850 evo 128GB. There was a clear attempt to defraud me as a customer. Photos: There were a few red flags in the photos. - the manual was glued on all 4 corners. This would prevent someone from inspecting the ssd. A new samsung evo ssd does not glue the corners of the user manaul. - there is no identifying sticker on the back of the SSD I did not see any obvious tampering with the box. The "protection" sticker was easy to lift up when I opened it. The box is clearly labeled correctly as the 2 TB samsung 860 evo.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Completely dead after a year - zero warning.
customer_reviews.text: I leverage Samsung storage products basically everywhere (2.5"/M2's)... Opted for an 860 EVO in an older, lightly used machine that needed some new life over an old mechanical 5400rpm drive. Purchased this 860 in May 2019 - has worked flawlessly until today (6/18/20) when it simply died without warning - no SMART errors, no warnings from the Samsung utility, nothing. No longer recognized by the system. Tried putting it in an external closure to no avail as well. So it essentially lasted for a year and failed outright. This is why I stick with the PRO line and shy away from the EVO or other budget models. I suggest you do the same.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mikelas

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this SSD
customer_reviews.text: Samsung makes excellent SSDs. After installing a smaller M.2 form factor drive (also Samsung) for my OS a couple years ago, prices for SSDs have come down considerably. My HDD storage array was beginning to slow and fail and I finally felt justified purchasing an SSD for all my storage. The drive itself was very lightweight and so easy to install. I immediately noticed massive performance differences in all areas. Even just navigating file directories felt so much snappier and now I can edit 4K video without having to render proxies. It's almost 2020, it's time to make the SSD switch!
customer_reviews.author: Connor Herman

customer_reviews.title: Defective! DO NOT BUY!!! NO CUSTOMER SUPPORT
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in samsung. The product never worked. Was a pain to install. Computer wouldnt start (took 5-15 times of hard booting to get it to start). When contacting samsung customer service was a joke. They were rude, unhelpful, and unapologetic. No help. No customer service. Terrible product. I sold the laptop just to never deal with Samsung again after this (and I had owned that laptop for goin on a decade, with many upgrades over the years). Sad to see a reliable company go down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Guest

customer_reviews.title: Quick fix for slow laptops! Reliable.
customer_reviews.text: I had two old HP laptops that were more than 5 years old and would take forever to start up and take 5 minutes to just open up the internet browser. Not wanting to buy a brand new laptop, I decided to just upgrade them. It was fairly simple to install the new SSD into my laptops if you know what you’re doing. After I changed it, the laptops load significantly faster and similar to how the laptops were when I first bought them. The loading screen takes less than a minute to open and browser takes less than 10 seconds. Definitely would buy if you’re looking for a quick fix for slower laptops.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Small, Super light, easy to install...
customer_reviews.text: Small, Super light, easy to install. I notice a small difference in speed, more at start up - and my 15" Mac Pro doesn't heat up like before with the old HD. But maybe my expectations were a bit high reading all the reviews. So I'm giving it 4 stars. I still have the same RAM as before. Maybe that will make it faster. All the same I'm SUPER Happy with it!!! You MUST buy the cable : USB3S2SAT3CB 3.0 to 2.5" SATA III Hard Drive Adapter Cable w/ UASP - SATA to USB 3.0 Converter for SSD/HDD It makes changing the HD to SSD so amazingly simple.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Fast, efficient, cost effective
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a Lenovo laptop running Win10 to reduce startup times. Great product - I wish the laptop had M.2 capability as 860 EVO operates through SATA port which keeps speed down. Magician software (downloaded from Samsung website) keeps TRIM operational in background. Still have not figured out how to use OPAL encryption - as this requires "extra software" which is not identified by Samsung or able to be identified in a Google search. Used Macrium software (free download) to clone the internal drive and USB adaptor to copy internal to SSD prior to swap. Samsung clone software did not identify all partitions, but Macrium copied all of the Lenovo partitions on the original drive.
customer_reviews.author: Burke Lee

customer_reviews.title: Drive Does Not Work
customer_reviews.text: This drive will not work with Samsung Data Migration Software. As someone who has installed many hard drives I was very frustrated with this device. Samsung's migration would not work so I contacted support. The rep who answered was worthless. He wouldn't answer any questions about how to resolve my issue. He simple said he couldn't help answer any question about Windows (basic things related to getting a hard drive to work). I will never buy a Samsung drive again. His attitude and unwillingness to support me was ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: My Profile

customer_reviews.title: Warranty not useful
customer_reviews.text: This is my 1st Samsung drive. About 2 years in and getting errors from Windows 10 that the drive has errors. Check disk fixes the errors but they come back within a few days, so I contacted Samsung. They will not send a new drive until you send back the bad drive. Once they get the drive they will erase and fix or replace the drive. This is not helpful if you have your OS and over 400GB of data on the drive and it still works. You would need a drive to clone the data to before sending the bad drive in for repair. Back to Western Digital Black drives. Never had an issue with one of those.
customer_reviews.author: Laura P.

customer_reviews.title: Extremely dependable
customer_reviews.text: I use nothing else but Samsung SSDs! This one was purchased to use as a second drive in a new machine for a Linux Mint install (the first drive is also a Samsung SSD with Windows 10 installed). They are fast, dependable and now are relatively inexpensive. In MY opinion... any machine built "today" should have an SSD installed in place of a platter drive. Install it, format it for your particular OS, and you're on your way. You definitely won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Rob

customer_reviews.title: Lightening fast!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as an upgrade for my wife's laptop - phenomenal speed and rapid mode is awesome! One caveat - her Dell laptop runs HOT with this thing in there. Reading multiple forums suggests this is due to the laptop being unleashed to it's full speed potential and maximizing other hardware components after removing the speed bump of her old HDD - unfortunately my ignorance to computer hardware technicals precludes me from an opinion in that regard though. Installation was a breeze and the Samsung cloning process was incredibly straightforward - as much so as cloning can be. This is my second Samsung 860 Evo and will certainly not be my last! Xbox one upgrade is next!
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Very good little SSD.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't looking to upgrade my Hybrid Hard drive until I got this on sale. Unlike the others I didn't opt to migrate my things over with the Samsung Magician as I needed to reload my system anyhow. I had no problems installing Windows 10 ver. 1809 on it whatsoever. It's very fast and process finished in less than 10 - 15 minutes. The system runs very fast with this new SSD. Start time is about maybe 5 to 10 seconds at max. Another good benefit as Samsung provides a program to monitor your SSD's lifespan. I've had no hiccups since installing it and would recommend this drive.
customer_reviews.author: Blues22475

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE: Dead SSD. Is not recognized, and cannot be found. EXPENSIVE BRICK!
customer_reviews.text: ORIGINAL REVIEW: I bought this in December for a PC build project. I finally got all of my components together and this SSD is NOT DETECTED....so it is just a BRICK. My official return window has passed, and I cannot reach Amazon due to this pandemic. UPDATED: I'm an idiot. This is not a "plug and play" unit and requires a little know-how to set up initially. Once you use "disc management" (Windows) and find your "unalocated" drive, you must then format your SSD for use. Thank you SAMSUNG US for your quick and easy tech support.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Crumpacker

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy to install-great speed improvement
customer_reviews.text: Came with software to allow cloning boot drive through a usb cable. I had the cable, but it is not supplied. Selected source and new drive and waited about 1 hr for cloning to occur. Swapped ssd for hd and it booted first try. Other than much faster, everything was as before with all shortcuts and apps working. Well designed solution. Mechanical installation was one for one and took less than 5 minutes. ?Highly recommend this if you want to breathe new life into a slightly sluggish computer
customer_reviews.author: S. Frankel

customer_reviews.title: Installed easily and increased the boot and operating speed of our older computer.
customer_reviews.text: Installed easily and increased the boot and operating speed of our older computer. We were going to have to replace our computer running powerpoint software. With this solid state drive we have increased our boot speed from 20 seconds to 6 seconds. The lag time for accessing pictures is gone. We have had the drive for almost a year now with no problems. We don't keep a lot of data files on this computer so we chose a lower volume drive. 250 gigabyte is small for today's machines but we will never fill it up.
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: compatiable with macbook pro 2012
customer_reviews.text: I installed it on my Macbook pro 2012 (non-retina), it is much faster and efficient! Here are the steps to make it work. 1. install mojave on usb and create a bootable usb using free disk drill 3 2. boot from usb and use disk utility to format samsung 860 APFS/GUID version 3. install mojave from usb 4. then migrate data using time machine 5. SMC reset - shut down - option/control/option/power together for 10 seconds 6. NRPM reset - option/command/P/R together 7. if options 5 and 6 still make your fan go crazy, then download free SSD fan control and select 'SMART' 8. reboot, it's a brand efficient and fast macbookpro
customer_reviews.author: Paul C.

customer_reviews.title: New life for my 2014 Mac Pro laptop
customer_reviews.text: First of all, I am a novice and never did anything like this before. I watched (several times) every youtube video I could find, read some google articles, took a deep breath and actually did it! Used the free Carbon Copy software to duplicate my old hard drive, and everything went smoothly. What a difference it makes with booting up or loading/looking thru pictures. Its like having a new computer! Definitely worth the cost & effort. Of course not much difference in browsing the internet since that depends on your router & internet provider. However any time you access something in your hard drive, its lightning fast! Very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: MikeA

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade the laptop HDD with an SSD by Samsung
customer_reviews.text: The Samsung SSD SATA III disk installation was almost intuitive. The hard part was choosing the brand, the capacity and the model. The Samsung brand has a reputation that cannot be ignored. The capacity of the existing HDD is 2TB. An expanded capacity was needed and the next size was 4TB. The relevant difference between models was the price. This difference was not significant due to a sale and I purchase the better model for a few buck more. Those that write about SSD upgrades pose a significant characteristic when they say that replacing the HDD with an SSD is like getting a better computer at a lower price.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph of Memphis

customer_reviews.title: Amazon rocks!
customer_reviews.text: Samsung products are top notch, however, there's always a possibility of a few lemons in the mix. I received my SSD promptly but it was defective a couple hours after installation. Samsung customer support is okay but they did not resolve my problem. Just when I think this was a total loss, Amazon stepped in and sent my replacement w/ overnight delivery. It pays to be a good customer, with a good history of making right choices prior to ordering and thus no returns w/o legitimate reasons (damage, inaccurate descriptions, etc.). I'm grateful that Amazon took care of me very promptly as the SSD is vital to the continuity of my business. Thanks again Amazon! You rock!
customer_reviews.author: H. LE

customer_reviews.title: You know why you are here!
customer_reviews.text: Its 1TB! And its a Samsung! I've had several of these over the years, installed countless Samsung SSDs in customer computers, and I have NEVER had one fail on me yet! Samsung knows how to do SSD and NAND storage! Simple as that. Just buy it, you will be happier for it! However, if running it externally on an Apple computer, be sure to use the fastest USB 3.1 gen2 enclosures available. If you do not have USB-C, then the next best thing is USB3.1 gen1. If you need a simple USB-C 3.1 gen 2 enclosure, I suggest the mediasonic HDM-U31C available here on amazon. That will get you the speeds you are looking for (520mbps+) on MacOS.
customer_reviews.author: Trips

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, great price
customer_reviews.text: The ssd and mount were really easy to use. I used free cloning (data migration) software from Samsung to transfer the files from my old hard drive to the ssd using a cable a friend gave me, and then I swapped out the drives with no problem. It took about 1 hour to clone the data and then 15 minutes to install the mount and ssd into an aging Lenovo m72e after watching a video on YouTube. I wish I had done this earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Lcm

customer_reviews.title: Very Fast!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cuz I had little space on my PC.. it’s fast (obviously, it’s an SSD).. I got the 500GB ones.. which is more than I needed, but it’s always good to be prepared.. For gaming.. yeah it loads the game quite fast.. but I can’t really compare it to anything since I’ve only been using SSDs.. Is it worth it? You could find a 1TB HDD out there easily.. but why would you do that.. except you just wanna use it to store some old stuff.. then sure go ahead.. but if you’re gonna install windows on it.. then 100% go for the SSD.. load things faster..
customer_reviews.author: Resky

customer_reviews.title: Installed in Macbook Pro 2012, with help from True Image 2020
customer_reviews.text: These things work and work well (also like Crucial's). Best possible $90 investment for upgrading ANY computer. Amazon delivered quickly, especially considering the pandemic. Because I use (and recommend) True Image 2020 I don't know how easy it would be to install without it (if you work on or have many computers, the 5-install licenses are actually cheap (and, again, highly recommended). I initially tried True Image 2018 (Mac) but it didn't have any cloning capacity. I do believe that TI made it much easier to clone than it would otherwise have been (I'm not really a Mac user, doing this for a friend) so I recommend the COMBINATION of an SSD and True Image 2020. Just FYI.
customer_reviews.author: DoodleLet

customer_reviews.title: Breathe new life into your computer
customer_reviews.text: I had problems with the painfully slow hard drive in my laptop. Boot times were long, gaming and internet browsing were painful, and running nearly any program (even just background tasks like windows installer) shot my disk usage up to 100%. After using Samsung's software to transfer my data (it took about three hours to transfer and install for 300GB, though that was probably due to the slow HDD), I popped in the new drive. Data, passwords, everything moved to the SSD. The whole process was seamless, and there were no extra programs to run or anything once the new drive is installed.
customer_reviews.author: Karou

customer_reviews.title: samsung quality 👌
customer_reviews.text: Just speaking to build and ease of installation, 5 stars. Can't go wrong with Samsung drives. Size and connectability are top quality, installation with Samsung data migration is the easiest I've ever experienced. Literally 2 steps and done in 30 min. The con: is im not seeing a BIG drastic improvement in processing on laptop. Not due to anything Samsung related, but with my old ryzen3 processor. Here's to hoping this will last me at least 5 yrs.👍
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bringing an old machine new life!
customer_reviews.text: This is a review on Samsung 860 EVO 500GB 2.5 Inch SATA III SSD (Just making that clear since with how 'reliable' Amazon is, and how multiple products end up on the same pages) Amazing freaking speeds! I'm using the Samsung Magician software to optimize performance, running on a 2014 HP PC with a 4820k & R9 270 w/32GB DDR3@1600C9 in quad channel on a IPIWB-PB pcb. All I can say is, if you have an old machine and are still running a physical hard drive, what are you waiting for?
customer_reviews.author: Skeptis Cycler

customer_reviews.title: What an improvement!
customer_reviews.text: I used this disk to replace a 1Tb Samsung hard drive (the system disk) on a Linux system I was able to copy my original to this one using Clonezilla, and it booted immediately. I was amazed how fast it was! I decided to freshly install Ubuntu 20.04 on it and again, it worked well and was much faster than the standard hard drive. I've had no problems at all with this SSD!
customer_reviews.author: Burns Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Best upgrade you can do!!
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to install this ssd and replace my gd. I was even more excited to use the migration software from the mfgr, but after four hours of “ unknown interruptions “, I was really down! I kept deleting programs, and nothing helped. Samsung support said to reinstall Windows, and I said no way was I doing that! After reading online, I found a different free migration software, Macrium, and it worked perfect the first time!! So, I replaced my old hd with this new ssd, and wow! What a difference!!! It took 20 secs to start up, before it was 3:20!! Truly life changing, so worth it!!
customer_reviews.author: HBAZ

customer_reviews.title: Major upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for the 500gb hard drive in my PS4. It was very easy to install and also made my system's performance better. Mine had 1.77tb of memory available once the PS4 firmware was installed. It took a couple days to download all my games, about 35 games total. After all my games were installed, I still had 415gb of free space. 100% satisfied, would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality replacement SSD
customer_reviews.text: I grabbed this as my original SSD of 250gb was getting a little cramped. I chose this drive after comparing warranty and MTBF (1.5 Million Hours Reliability). On the Samsung site there is a super simple, easy and no-brainer utility to clone the contents of your system drive to the new Samsung drive. I grabbed an old backup drive in an external enclosure, swapped the old drive with the new Samsung and ran the utility. It took about 3 hours, then shut down the computer to make it simple to replace the hard drive. So, after 3.5 hours of having this drive, I had it in the computer and am writing this review from it.
customer_reviews.author: Roger T.

customer_reviews.title: It's big, and it's fast.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a failed 3TB (spinning platter) hard drive in my iMac. There don't appear to be many SSDs yet that meet the minimum capacity (if it's replacing a 3TB drive, there's a reason, and anything smaller just won't cut it.) If it were going anywhere but into an iMac, I'd have to give it full points for ease of installation. Apple doesn't do "ease of installation", though (not the drive's fault). Now that it's in and working, I'm happy with the speed, and the extra terabyte is more than welcome :)
customer_reviews.author: G. Thornock

customer_reviews.title: Excellent high-speed SATA drive
customer_reviews.text: I installed this as a secondary drive to supplement my Samsung 970 Pro primary drive. I know many would consider this overkill for a Media/Game drive, but after getting accustomed to SSD speeds, using a hard drive is slow torture. A 250GB - 512GB NVMe boot drive and a 1TB - 2TB SATA SSD Media/Game drive is the best combination I've found for both price and speed. There are other less expensive SATA SSDs that are quite good, but with both drives made by the same company, I can monitor the status of both drives from the same program (Samsung Magician).
customer_reviews.author: Carl E. Meece III

customer_reviews.title: Great price/performance ratio.
customer_reviews.text: Ignore the highly rated 1 star review with the low speeds. That user is clearly using the drive in a device with only SATA2 speeds(300MB/s theoretical max), or has the device configured to run in that mode. I have this drive in a Dell 7577 and get well over 500MB/s reads. If I move the drive into my wife's 2009 Macbook Pro, which only has SATA2, it scores ~280MB/s. My Dell came with an NVMe boot drive, so this 860 Evo was only for secondary storage for games. They load as quickly as ever off of this drive without issues. A great drive with a great price/performance ratio, assuming you have a sufficiently quick SATA bus to accommodate the speeds.
customer_reviews.author: zomgyeti

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy That New Laptop.
customer_reviews.text: Thought I needed a new laptop. My HP Envy originally came with win 8 and I had installed win 10 on it. It has become slower and slower over time and thought I would replace it. Instead I replaced the old hard drive with this SSD and it is so fast now it unbelievable. Where it used to take several minutes to boot and actually be ready to work now it takes seconds. I bought and enclosure, for about 20 bucks and installed the drive into it, downloaded Samsung software to transfer hard drive, super easy then followed instructions. If you've ever been inside your computer before you will have no trouble doing this.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Haire

customer_reviews.title: Blackmagic Ursa test
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for the Blackmagic Ursa using the cfast to esata method. I have several cards that work great like this but this 1TB ssd instantly dropped frames after 12 seconds when shooting at the maximum 4k raw film settings. I’m returning it and buying a SanDisk 1TB next. Those have been working thus far up to 500 gigs. I
customer_reviews.author: WeMakeFilms

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  What an improvement
customer_reviews.text: I put this SSD into a laptop that I had all but written off as it was about 10 years old. I needed one for our kids to do schoolwork on over the summer. What a difference. I want to put one of these in every computer I have, but the 1TB model is pushing $170, and that is what I'll need for a few of my computers. Installation was simple, and Samsung's software made it very easy. Best money I've spent in a long, long time.
customer_reviews.author: Just Sayin'

customer_reviews.title: MOST UNRELIABLE DRIVE I EVER HAD.
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst drive I have ever had. Every day it pops up saying scan for errors. I scan and then it says it recovered. The next day same thing. I called Samsung and waiting for there reply. After paying $800 I would like to return for a refund. From what I see I even need to pay for the return shipping. I just checked with AMAZON and they said I need to get a letter from the manufacturer saying it is defective before they refund my money. Well this will be the last item I purchase from AMAZON. There are many other places probably better. Giving them thousands of dollars and no return.
customer_reviews.author: R. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for my 5 year old laptop
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to upgrade my HP Pavilion 15-p100dx laptop purchase in 2014. The laptop came with a 750GB hard drive. After years of use it has slowed quite a bit even though I use utility programs to maintain the drive, registry, and unneeded files. Boot time to login was one to several minutes. After login it was a few more minutes to ready to use. The hard drive usage was frequently 100%. After cloning the hard drive to this SSD and installing it, boot time to login is about 15 seconds, and it is ready to use almost instantly after login. This has made a tremendous difference in using my laptop, putting off a replacement for quite a while
customer_reviews.author: Joe H

customer_reviews.title: It's a Samsung
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 versions of the 860's one for a laptop (500gb replacing a 1TB) and a desktop (1TB replacing a 2TB). My primary concern was having either hard drive fail (moving parts). I had an HD fail and the recovery of much far exceeded it's value. These are sturdier and faster. My boot time from off was cut to a 1/3 or less of the original time. Both are also running much cooler. The laptop has not triggered the internal fan once since the change. If you have not gone to SSD do it they are cheap enough now to get GB or TB sizes for under $200.
customer_reviews.author: SF GIANT-49ER

customer_reviews.title: I can't believe how bad this experience has been. Samsung?
customer_reviews.text: I tried to format this for my Macintosh, and it kept failing. When it finally did work, it only had 1.8TB out of all 4TB available. The rest was not there. I tried reformatting, erasing, and still nothing. At this point, I don't know if I can trust this SSD with my data. The tools they provide, like their "Magician" software, is not available for the Mac. They also have firmware updates available, but they don't provide them in a format that can be loaded on the Mac, and they also don't tell you how you are to know if the brand new product you got, already has the update or needs it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Zabetian

customer_reviews.title: The Samsung Data Migration software made this replacement pain free
customer_reviews.text: Its been a couple months now since I installed this new SSD to replace a several years older spinning HDD drive. The Samsung Data Migration software worked really well and was easy to use. I've not run into any problems with the OS and data transferred from the old to the new drive. I would say it has been an increase in speed as well and being much newer than my many years older drive should give me longer use in the PC I installed it in. I also doubled my hard drive storage space with this upgrade. Happy to have selected this model.
customer_reviews.author: Agent 92

customer_reviews.title: Resurrected my Dell All-in-1
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this drive and the Apricorn EZ GIG IV clone software to hopefully avoid replacing my Dell Inspiron 24 AIO. The Cloning process of my old 1TB drive took about 50 Minutes with no issues. I was never happy with the speed of this system, Booting was slow, and Excel spreadsheets took forever to calculate and save. I use Excel with macros extensively. I priced new systems and rather than spend $1500 on a new one I bought this drive. It is amazing. My Dell now runs faster than the day it was new. Boot ups are fast and excel runs great. Saved me the purchase of a new system for some time to come
customer_reviews.author: Edward A. Blanchard

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Usually I am a cheap person that always try to save some money but many years ago I did the same with the hard drives. You probably already know how it ends: HDD failed 2 years later and I loss a big deal of important information work-related. I learned the lesson and I never spare on expenses when it comes to HDDs. That is why Samsung is my choice. I installed this one on my Lenovo X270 and I am extremely happy with the performance. I have attached a screenshot of the software Samsung Magician detecting as genuine, make sure that the item is ship and sold by Amazon. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: JARELLANO

customer_reviews.title: Samsung SSD 860 EVO 500GB 2.5 INCH SATA III INTERNAL SSD (MZ-76E500B/AM
customer_reviews.text: THE FACT THAT IT TOOK ME A WHILE TO FIGURE IT OUT. IT NEEDS TO BE MADE MORE HOW TO GO ABOUT HOW TO FIND ONE'S WAY ON THE KNOW HOW? customer_reviews.author: Pablo Montalvo Jr.

customer_reviews.title: worked really well
customer_reviews.text: I had an i5 laptop that just seemed incredibly slow. I knew it had no virus. It came slow from Amazon. I took a guess about the 1 tb drive being very slow. I replaced it with this SSD and suddenly the bootup and speed of the machine makes it a very different laptop. I used a desktop to copy the existing hard drive to the Samsung 860. This worked very well using Paragon software. It was an HP laptop and I am surprised that HP managed to find a hard drive as slow as the one the put in this laptop.
customer_reviews.author: amxcoder

customer_reviews.title: Excellent SSD
customer_reviews.text: I normally use Crucial drives but decided to go the Samsung route this time since, at the time, it was a few dollars cheaper. Used it in an older desktop to replace a slow HDD that was a few years old. Used the Samsung Migration tool to transfer the OS from the old HDD, then simply swapped the drives. Ran into no problems whatsoever. I did order an adapter bracket to fit the SSD into the HDD bracket. Though in hindsight double sided tape or velcro would have worked as well.
customer_reviews.author: tzigrel

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with all Windows 10 Machines
customer_reviews.text: Watch the compatibility product information mentioned below: WARRANTY AND COMPATIBILITY: 5-year limited warranty; Windows 8/Windows 7/Windows Server 2003 (32 bit and 64 bit), Vista (SP1 and above), XP (SP2 and above), MAC OSX and Linux Windows 10 is missing in the above list. My HP Pavilion Windows 10 64 bit machine, was unable to detect, initialize or format the drive, using default or third party disk management/partition tools. Beware before buying...
customer_reviews.author: Karan

customer_reviews.title: Tough to get Started
customer_reviews.text: Warning, it arrives non bootable. So, even the samsung software wont help you make it bootable. Yes, if you want to just image or copy over another drive, it won't work out of the box, as you do have to do some trickery first. But, after that, the SSD is such an improvement for speed on your computer - its ridiculous. I always thought more ram, or better video card, or faster processor should be the most noticeable change you could make for a system improvement. Nope, the Solid State Drive is better than any of those other upgrades. Faster boot, faster system loads, faster file transfers, - everything - browsing - seems faster.
customer_reviews.author: Tomxypdq

customer_reviews.title: This is not 1 TB
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the 1 TB fool you--this is not a 1 TB drive -- it is in fact only 930GB so quite misleading advertising; that's 70GB less than advertised. Making matters worse the software they suggest you install to manage the drive (Samsung Magician) doesn't work for most of the menu items shown--basically all you see is drive information.
customer_reviews.author: Africalion

customer_reviews.title: Fast drive that's continued to perform without issues
customer_reviews.text: SSD's bring new life to older computers, and this drive did just that for my application helping someone avoid replacing a complete laptop. The Samsung data migration software works well and for the most part makes the transition nearly seamless. Drive has been in use now for several months without issue.
customer_reviews.author: ecugt

customer_reviews.title: The, EVO ssd
customer_reviews.text: Hey sports fans. A very big leap in hardware for my old laptop. I though that my old Lenovo B590 was fast after I put Linux Mint OS on it, (good-bye Win. 7). Load times were around 60 seconds, or so. Now, blink, and you'll be in your password screen. I believe the load time is around 10 seconds. Other software loads very quick too. Firefox is much quicker, I've noticed. I'm very impressed with the performance, I look at the other PC's I own, and I can't wait to upgrade them as well. I'll be back to purchase a few more EVO ssd, money well spent indeed. Have a very nice day.
customer_reviews.author: MegaDave

customer_reviews.title: It's a piece of $hit
customer_reviews.text: Let's see, hardly used as the computer build it's in kept giving endless errors. I have literally ruled every other possible reason out, including testing the new ram sticks and using another motherboard, CPU, cables... everything. So much for Samsung quality, I don't see how their crap is so highly rated, I don't care if they make (overpriced) Galaxy phones, they also used batteries the exploded. Surprised there hasn't been a flexible version of one of phones like Apple put out a fee years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Yammer

customer_reviews.title: This is working nicely thus far
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this much, but I've copied some large video files to it over USB3 and had no problems - transfer was quick. Currently using it as an external and will likely continue to do so. I sometimes take images of computers that I'm working on, so I wanted something big(ger) and faster since the machines that I upgrade/repair have bigger disks. I've used several Samsung EVO 850/860 disks in the past and never had problems. I'd buy this one again.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Samsung 860EVO SSD
customer_reviews.text: Great speed, 5 year warranty great support programs.. Update 12/12/2018: I put two of these in aging and slow laptops for friends of my son. The performance improvements were mind blowing but this is not to say that other manufacturers SSDs might not have accomplished the same thing. I have one as the boot drive on my pc replacing a Crucial MX500 SSD and really don't see much, if any, improvement. I swapped drives to take advantage of the fact that my Crucial drive was down to 96% live and the new drive should last at least 8 Years, if not more, although at 84 I may not be around to appreciate it.
customer_reviews.author: James P. Malone

customer_reviews.title: Performance Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a great SSD product and upgrade for any Apple or Windows computer. The build quality is solid and light weight if you decide you want to use it for a laptop. I am upgrading an older iMac (standard HDD) and the performance upgrade is definitely there. Boot up time speeds now within 30 secs as compared to a couple of minutes prior. This is expected from SSDs, however, the read/write speeds for this particular EVO model is more on the premium side. Well-worth the extra little cost then the other brands. I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin F.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing drive
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to replace the previous model Evo 850. The new drive is twice the capacity of my previous drive and I noticed it's noticeably faster. The previous drive still worked after almost 1TB writes. Samsung makes great SSDs. I've had better luck with them than other brands. If you're using this as a boot drive in windows, be sure to install their magician software. It lets speed up the drive operations as well as check on the health and install firmware updates. I did have to update the drive firmware when I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas Holt

customer_reviews.title: Installation for HD's not as simple as they used to be.
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, to get my computer to recognize this right click Control Panel > Administrative Tools > Computer Management > Disk Management > Right click unrecognized drive and format > Be sure to select the correct cluster size > Ok. Back in the day you could plug it in, right click your HD under My Computer and format. Secondly, this does not come with any hardware to mount so you will need to get your own one way or another. They are M3 x 3. Other than these factors, the HDD works as intended. Theyve been installed in system for about a month now and have not encountered any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Bought 500GB SSD, only got 408.5GB from it.
customer_reviews.text: Product was relatively easy to install in my PS4 once I figured out how to install the system software. It works as it should but I am very unhappy with the storage capacity I received. I bought the samsung 860 EVO with 500GB capacity, but it only has 408.5GB capacity. I understand that every drive has varying capacity, but a loss of 91.5GB from a SSD that claims to be 500GB is ridiculous. It says the TurboWrite buffer size varies, but is around 22GB, but my 91.5GB memory loss is unacceptable. Very unhappy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Incompatible with certain AMD & ASMedia chipsets
customer_reviews.text: This drive sent me on a roller coaster ride of swapping SATA ports, SATA cables, and even inserting an extra controller card. It was about half-way though the madness that I realized Samsung's Magician software warned about this issue. (It's not front-and-center. You have to manually check the Compatibility tab to see it.) This is so sad. My 850 EVO has been humming along inside my system with nary a peep for 2 years now. What kind of change in the 860 EVO made it "worth it" for Samsung to introduce incompatibility?
customer_reviews.author: BrainwreckedTech

customer_reviews.title: It Sped Up My Computer
customer_reviews.text: I was running on a drive that was chronically full all the time. I would experience 100% processor use all day every day literally. I upgraded to this drive (former drive was 150Gb don't judge me) and the problem went away. It also sped up my internet connection massively. This appears to be a very specific problem to my use case of having a drive that is always full but still it fixed a lot of issues on my machine. Other drive was SSD too so it wasn't a switch of technology just an upgrade to storage capacity. Very good improvement!
customer_reviews.author: Jonno N.

customer_reviews.title: excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I use these as primary drives in all my computers as well as additional secondary storage drives in my main PC. I use these to make clone backups for each of my computers and keep the backups in a safe deposit box to protect me from both Windows crashes and a hostile takeover, as well as store one inside my PC (disconnected from its SATA cable). If I crash, it takes me 5 minutes to get back up and running. The cloning software that comes with them works well. Certainly lightening fast compared to HHD.
customer_reviews.author: James G LoDolce

customer_reviews.title: best bang for buck
customer_reviews.text: got this hard drive for my nieces laptop she did have a 1tb toshiba mechanical hard drive that was going bad it was always running at 100% causing the computer to become so slow it was nearly un usable so i found this samsung ssd and yea i sacrificed half of the storage space but its worth it to get the performance since she games a lot, super easy worked like a charm right out the box installed windows from a flash drive it really only took about 20 minutes total to boot up and install windows pretty amazing and its samsung so you know right there its quality
customer_reviews.author: Nick636n8r

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I've read the reviews on Samsung SSDs and they are good. I work in IT and replace components routinely. One of the best upgrades for speed and performance is installing an SSD. My Windows machine with a 5600 RPM mechanical drive booted to the desktop within 3 minutes. With the SSD that time is now 30 seconds. SSDs have no moving parts and hence no rotational delay. I highly recommend the Samsung line and avoid the cheap or no name brands. As always, do your due diligence before any purchase. But with these products, you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: James Hutton

customer_reviews.title: Fast and, above all, reliable.
customer_reviews.text: This is the "old style" Samsung SSD (not the QVO). This is the reliable one, the newer (larger/cheaper) units do not have a good track record and, technologically speaking, are poorly designed. But those are cheap and, if you don't mind oats that have already been through the horse, go buy one. This one, however, does its job without complaints. In all the years I've been servicing computers, I've only seen one Samsung SSD of this design fail. If they keep making them, I'll keep buying them.
customer_reviews.author: B. Levine

customer_reviews.title: Lightening Fast
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded my new 14 inch Asus Notebook with this and amazing. First of all, Samsung Magician said that it wouldn't be compatible....but after downloading migration software off of Samsung.com/samsungssd it said no compatibility issues. Microsoft Office Word went from nearly 2 minutes from clicking to operational to under 5 seconds. The $10 cord off Amazon worked perfectly.....and super easy. No need for me to spend the $20 plus on a kit. Highly recommend this even and I went from a terabyte to 500g.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My 2014 computer runs like a 2020 model
customer_reviews.text: The Samsung 860 EVO was installed in a Toshiba Satellite S55-A5176 laptop computer running Windows 8.1. I took most of the day to install. I tried free software off the internet and none of it worked for me; that is why it took all day, it takes time to transfer your information. I went to the Samsung website where you can download their software to clone the Samsung SSD drive; that worked well. My computer boots up and shuts down instantly, software runs faster and browsing the internet is also much faster.
customer_reviews.author: JES100FISH

product_meta.title: Samsung 860 EVO 500GB 2.5 Inch SATA III Internal SSD (MZ-76E500B/AM)
product_meta.description: Capacity:500GB| Style:SSDThe SSD you trust: The newest edition to the world's best-selling SATA SSD series, the Samsung 860 EVO SSD is specially designed to enhance performance of mainstream PCs and laptops. With the latest V-NAND technology, this fast and reliable Solid State Drive comes in a wide range of compatible form factors and capacities. Its enhanced performance delivers consistent speeds, even under heavy workloads and multi-tasking, allowing for faster file transfers. The 860 EVO performs at sequential read speeds of up to 550MB/s with Intelligent TurboWrite technology, and sequential write speeds of up to 520MB/s. The TurboWrite buffer size is upgraded from 12GB to 78GB (performance may vary based on user's system hardware and configuration). The 860 EVO also offers boosted endurance of up to 8x higher TBW (Terabytes Written) than the 850 EVO. Feel secure storing and rendering large-sized 4K videos and 3D data used by the latest applications. The smart compatibility of the SSD lets you benefit from faster, more fluid communication with your host system. The refined ECC (Error Correction Code) algorithm and a new MJX controller generate higher speeds, and the improved queued trim enhances Linux compatibility. The 860 EVO provides reliability of 1.5 million hours (MTBF).
feature_bullets: Innovative V-Nand Technology: Powered by Samsung V-NAND Technology, the 860 EVO SSD offers optimized performance for everyday computing as well as rendering large-sized 4K videos and 3D data used by the latest applications
Enhanced read write speeds: Sequential read and write performance levels of up to 550MB/s and 520MB/s, respectively
Secure encryption: Protect data by selecting security options, including AES 256-bit hardware-based encryption compliant with TCG Opal and IEEE 1670
Warranty and compatibility: 5-year limited warranty; Windows 8/Windows 7/Windows Server 2003 (32 bit and 64 bit), Vista (SP1 and above), XP (SP2 and above), MAC OSX and Linux
Included contents: 2.5 inches (7 millimeter) SATA 3 (6 Gb/s) SSD & user manual (All other cables, screws, brackets not included); Reliability (MTBF): 1.5 Million Hours Reliability (MTBF)
